intro: Arrabidaea candicans var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved arrabidaea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant is notable for its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom during the rainy season. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
